Anaconda.desc: Anaconda is a distribution of the Python and R programming languages for scientific computing.

Clink.desc: Clink is a powerful Bash-compatible command-line interface (CLIenhancement for Windows, adding features like syntax highlighting and improved history).

CMake.desc: CMake is an open-source, cross-platform family of tools designed to build, test and package software.

DaxStudio.desc: DAX (Data Analysis eXpressions) Studio is the ultimate tool for executing and analyzing DAX queries against Microsoft Tabular models.

Docker Desktop.desc: Docker Desktop is a powerful tool for containerized application development and deployment.

Git.desc: Git is a distributed version control system widely used for tracking changes in source code during software development.

Git Butler.desc: A Git client for simultaneous branches on top of your existing workflow.

Git Extensions.desc: Git Extensions is a graphical user interface for Git, providing additional features for easier source code management.

GitHub CLI.desc: GitHub CLI is a command-line tool that simplifies working with GitHub directly from the terminal.

GitHub Desktop.desc: GitHub Desktop is a visual Git client that simplifies collaboration on GitHub repositories with an easy-to-use interface.

GitKraken Client.desc: GitKraken Client is a powerful visual Git client from Axosoft that works with ALL git repositories on any hosting environment.

Godot Engine.desc: Godot Engine is a free, open-source 2D and 3D game engine with a focus on usability and flexibility.

Gitify.desc: GitHub notifications on your menu bar.

Go.desc: Go (or Golang) is a statically typed, compiled programming language designed for simplicity, reliability, and efficiency.

Helix.desc: Helix is a neovim alternative built in rust.

Amazon Corretto 8 (LTS).desc: Amazon Corretto is a no-cost, multiplatform, production-ready distribution of the Open Java Development Kit (OpenJDK).

Amazon Corretto 11 (LTS).desc: Amazon Corretto is a no-cost, multiplatform, production-ready distribution of the Open Java Development Kit (OpenJDK).

Amazon Corretto 17 (LTS).desc: Amazon Corretto is a no-cost, multiplatform, production-ready distribution of the Open Java Development Kit (OpenJDK).

Amazon Corretto 21 (LTS).desc: Amazon Corretto is a no-cost, multiplatform, production-ready distribution of the Open Java Development Kit (OpenJDK).

Jetbrains Toolbox.desc: Jetbrains Toolbox is a platform for easy installation and management of JetBrains developer tools.

Lazygit.desc: Simple terminal UI for git commands

Neovim.desc: Neovim is a highly extensible text editor and an improvement over the original Vim editor.

NodeJS.desc: NodeJS is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine for building server-side and networking applications.

NodeJS LTS.desc: NodeJS LTS provides Long-Term Support releases for stable and reliable server-side JavaScript development.

Node Version Manager.desc: Node Version Manager (NVM) for Windows allows you to easily switch between multiple Node.js versions.

Oh My Posh (Prompt).desc: Oh My Posh is a cross-platform prompt theme engine for any shell.

Postman.desc: Postman is a collaboration platform for API development that simplifies the process of developing APIs.

Python3.desc: Python is a versatile programming language used for web development, data analysis, artificial intelligence, and more.

Rust.desc: Rust is a programming language designed for safety and performance, particularly focused on systems programming.

Starship (Shell Prompt).desc: Starship is a minimal, fast, and customizable prompt for any shell.

Sublime Merge.desc: Sublime Merge is a Git client with advanced features and a beautiful interface.

Sublime Text.desc: Sublime Text is a sophisticated text editor for code, markup, and prose.

Swift toolchain.desc: Swift is a general-purpose programming language that's approachable for newcomers and powerful for experts.

Code With Mu (Mu Editor).desc: Mu is a Python code editor for beginner programmers

Unity Game Engine.desc: Unity is a powerful game development platform for creating 2D, 3D, augmented reality, and virtual reality games.

Vagrant.desc: Vagrant is an open-source tool for building and managing virtualized development environments.

Visual Studio 2022.desc: Visual Studio 2022 is an integrated development environment (IDE) for building, debugging, and deploying applications.

VS Code.desc: Visual Studio Code is a free, open-source code editor with support for multiple programming languages.

VS Codium.desc: VSCodium is a community-driven, freely-licensed binary distribution of Microsoft's VS Code.

Wezterm.desc: WezTerm is a powerful cross-platform terminal emulator and multiplexer

Yarn.desc: Yarn is a fast, reliable, and secure dependency management tool for JavaScript projects.

Miniconda.desc: Miniconda is a free minimal installer for conda. It is a small bootstrap version of Anaconda that includes only conda, Python, the packages they both depend on, and a small number of other useful packages (like pip, zlib, and a few others).

Pixi.desc: Pixi is a fast software package manager built on top of the existing conda ecosystem. Spins up development environments quickly on Windows, macOS and Linux. Pixi supports Python, R, C/C++, Rust, Ruby, and many other languages.

Eclipse Temurin.desc: Eclipse Temurin is the open source Java SE build based upon OpenJDK.

Python Version Manager (pyenv-win).desc: pyenv for Windows is a simple python version management tool. It lets you easily switch between multiple versions of Python.

Fast Node Manager.desc: Fast Node Manager (fnm) allows you to switch your Node version by using the Terminal

Aegisub.desc: Aegisub is a free, cross-platform open source tool for creating and modifying subtitles. Aegisub makes it quick and easy to time subtitles to audio, and features many powerful tools for styling them, including a built-in real-time video preview.

Fork.desc: Fork - a fast and friendly git client.
